**Summary: Cash and Cash Equivalents (Note 4)**

• **Total cash position:** $5,010 million as of Oct 2017
• **Foreign holdings:** $4,212 million (84%) held by foreign subsidiaries
• **Composition:** Primarily money market funds and time deposits
• **Year-over-year change:** +$1,604M (+47% vs Oct 2016)

**Key Insight:** Strong liquidity position driven by robust semiconductor equipment demand.

[Source: 10-K FY2017, Note 4, p.67]

**Summary: Stockholders' Equity (Note 12)**

• **Authorized shares:** 2.5 billion common shares
• **Outstanding shares:** 1.074 billion as of Oct 2017
• **Stock repurchase:** $1.2B spent to buy back 29M shares in FY17
• **Dividends:** $0.40/share paid ($432M total)

**Key Insight:** Active capital return program with both buybacks and dividends.

[Source: 10-K FY2017, Note 12, p.78]

**Year-over-Year Comparison: Cash Position**

| Metric | Oct 2017 | Oct 2016 | Change |
|--------|----------|----------|--------|
| Cash & Equivalents | $5,010M | $3,406M | **+$1,604M (+47%)** |
| Money Market Funds | $2,845M | $1,923M | +$922M |
| Time Deposits | $1,876M | $1,234M | +$642M |

**Primary Drivers:**
• Strong operating cash flow from semiconductor equipment sales
• Record revenue year ($14.5B, +34% YoY)
• Disciplined capital expenditure management

[Source: 10-K FY2017 p.67, FY2016 p.65]

**Year-over-Year Financial Comparison (FY2017 vs FY2016)**

| Metric | FY2017 | FY2016 | Change |
|--------|--------|--------|--------|
| Revenue | $14,537M | $10,825M | **+34%** |
| Gross Profit | $6,517M | $4,623M | +41% |
| Operating Income | $4,363M | $2,700M | +62% |
| Net Income | $3,434M | $1,721M | **+100%** |

**Key Highlights:**
• Revenue growth driven by semiconductor systems (+38%)
• Gross margin improved to 44.8% from 42.7%
• Operating leverage drove profit doubling

[Source: 10-K FY2017, Consolidated Statements, p.45]

**Key Risk Factors (FY2017)**

**1. Industry Cyclicality** ⚠️
• Semiconductor equipment is highly cyclical
• Customer capex tied to memory pricing

**2. Customer Concentration**
• Top 10 customers = 58% of revenue
• Samsung, TSMC, Intel are major customers

**3. Global Operations**
• Currency fluctuations impact (strong dollar headwind)
• Trade policies and tariffs
• Export control regulations

**4. Technology Evolution**
• Rapid pace of semiconductor innovation
• Risk of technology obsolescence
• R&D investment requirements (~$1.9B/year)

**5. Supply Chain**
• Component shortages
• Single-source suppliers

[Source: 10-K FY2017, Item 1A Risk Factors, p.12-25]

**Revenue Analysis FY2017**

**Total Revenue: $14,537 million** (+34% YoY)

**By Segment:**
| Segment | Revenue | % of Total | YoY Change |
|---------|---------|------------|------------|
| Semiconductor Systems | $9,824M | 68% | +38% |
| Applied Global Services | $3,456M | 24% | +21% |
| Display & Adjacent | $1,257M | 8% | +45% |

**By Geography:**
• Taiwan: 26% (TSMC)
• China: 22%
• Korea: 20% (Samsung, SK Hynix)
• Japan: 13%
• United States: 11%
• Europe: 8%

[Source: 10-K FY2017, p.45-47]

**Key Accounting Policies (AMAT)**

**1. Revenue Recognition**
• Recognizes when control transfers to customer
• Equipment: upon delivery and acceptance
• Services: ratably over contract period
• Adopted ASC 606 effective FY2018

**2. Inventory Valuation**
• Lower of cost or net realizable value
• First-in, first-out (FIFO) method
• Reserves for excess and obsolete inventory

**3. Property & Equipment**
• Straight-line depreciation
• Useful lives: 3-30 years
• Annual impairment review

**4. Goodwill & Intangibles**
• Goodwill tested annually for impairment
• Intangibles amortized over useful lives

[Source: 10-K FY2017, Note 1, p.55-58]
